parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

active.description: Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to `true` to send notifications.

config.description: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook.

content_type.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include `json` and `form`. The default is `form`.

insecure_ssl.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for `url` will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include `0` (verification is performed) and `1` (verification is not performed). The default is `0`. **We strongly recommend not setting this to `1` as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.**

secret.description: If provided, the `secret` will be used as the `key` to generate the HMAC hex digest value in the [`X-Hub-Signature`](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers) header.

url.description: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

events.description: The [events](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/webhooks/event-payloads) that trigger this webhook. A global webhook can be triggered by `user` and `organization` events. Default: `user` and `organization`.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the hook.
parameters.name: hook_id

post.description: This will trigger a [ping event](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/webhooks/#ping-event) to be sent to the webhook.

image_url.description: URL from which to download a tarball of this environment.

delete.description:
If you attempt to delete an environment that cannot be deleted, you will receive a `422 Unprocessable Entity` response.

The possible error messages are:

*   _Cannot modify or delete the default environment_
*   _Cannot delete environment that has hooks_
*   _Cannot delete environment when download is in progress_

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the pre-receive environment.
parameters.name: pre_receive_environment_id

errors.message: Cannot modify or delete the default environment

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the pre-receive environment.
parameters.name: pre_receive_environment_id

patch.description: You cannot modify the default environment. If you attempt to modify the default environment, you will receive a `422 Unprocessable Entity` response.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the pre-receive environment.
parameters.name: pre_receive_environment_id

image_url.description: URL from which to download a tarball of this environment.

errors.message: Cannot modify or delete the default environment

post.description:
Triggers a new download of the environment tarball from the environment's `image_url`. When the download is finished, the newly downloaded tarball will overwrite the existing environment.

If a download cannot be triggered, you will receive a `422 Unprocessable Entity` response.

The possible error messages are:

* _Cannot modify or delete the default environment_
* _Can not start a new download when a download is in progress_

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the pre-receive environment.
parameters.name: pre_receive_environment_id

errors.message: Can not start a new download when a download is in progress

get.description: In addition to seeing the download status at the "[Get a pre-receive environment](#get-a-pre-receive-environment)" endpoint, there is also this separate endpoint for just the download status.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the pre-receive environment.
parameters.name: pre_receive_environment_id

get.summary: Get the download status for a pre-receive environment

items.description: The authorization for an OAuth app, GitHub App, or a Personal Access Token.

permissions.description: The permissions granted to the user-to-server access token.

actions.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for GitHub Actions workflows, workflow runs, and artifacts.

administration.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for repository creation, deletion, settings, teams, and collaborators creation.

checks.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for checks on code.

contents.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for repository contents, commits, branches, downloads, releases, and merges.

deployments.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for deployments and deployment statuses.

environments.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for managing repository environments.

issues.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for issues and related comments, assignees, labels, and milestones.

members.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for organization teams and members.

metadata.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to search repositories, list collaborators, and access repository metadata.

organization_administration.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage access to an organization.

organization_hooks.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage the post-receive hooks for an organization.

organization_packages.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for organization packages published to GitHub Packages.

organization_personal_access_token_reque.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for viewing and managing fine-grained personal access tokens that have been approved by an organization.

organization_personal_access_tokens.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for viewing and managing fine-grained personal access token requests to an organization.

organization_plan.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for viewing an organization's plan.

organization_projects.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage organization projects and projects beta (where available).

organization_secrets.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage organization secrets.

organization_self_hosted_runners.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage GitHub Actions self-hosted runners available to an organization.

organization_user_blocking.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage users blocked by the organization.

packages.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for packages published to GitHub Packages.

pages.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to retrieve Pages statuses, configuration, and builds, as well as create new builds.

pull_requests.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for pull requests and related comments, assignees, labels, milestones, and merges.

repository_hooks.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage the post-receive hooks for a repository.

repository_projects.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage repository projects, columns, and cards.

secret_scanning_alerts.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage secret scanning alerts.

secrets.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage repository secrets.

security_events.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage security events like code scanning alerts.

single_file.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage just a single file.

statuses.description: The level of permission to grant the access token for commit statuses.

team_discussions.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage team discussions and related comments.

vulnerability_alerts.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to manage Dependabot alerts.

workflows.description: The level of permission to grant the access token to update GitHub Actions workflow files.

items.title: Authorization

delete.description: Deletes a personal access token. Returns a `403 - Forbidden` status when a personal access token is in use. For example, if you access this endpoint with the same personal access token that you are trying to delete, you will receive this error.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the token.
parameters.name: token_id

delete.description:
Deleting a user will delete all their repositories, gists, applications, and personal settings. [Suspending a user](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/reference/enterprise-admin#suspend-a-user) is often a better option.

You can delete any user account except your own.

parameters.description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
parameters.name: username

201.description: Response when creating a new impersonation OAuth token

post.description:
**Deprecation Notice:** GitHub AE will discontinue OAuth endpoints that contain `access_token` in the path parameter. We have introduced new endpoints that allow you to securely manage tokens for OAuth Apps by moving `access_token` to the request body. For more information, see the [blog post](https://developer.github.com/changes/2020-02-14-deprecating-oauth-app-endpoint/).

OAuth applications can use this API method to reset a valid OAuth token without end-user involvement. Applications must save the "token" property in the response because changes take effect immediately. You must use [Basic Authentication](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/overview/other-authentication-methods#basic-authentication) when accessing this endpoint, using the OAuth application's `client_id` and `client_secret` as the username and password. Invalid tokens will return `404 NOT FOUND`.

parameters.description: The client ID of the GitHub app.
parameters.name: client_id

delete.description: Removes the global announcement banner in your enterprise.

get.description: Gets the current message and expiration date of the global announcement banner in your enterprise.

announcement.description: The announcement text in GitHub Flavored Markdown. For more information about GitHub Flavored Markdown, see "[Basic writing and formatting syntax](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax)."

expires_at.description: The time at which the announcement expires. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. To set an announcement that never expires, omit this parameter, set it to `null`, or set it to an empty string.

patch.description: Sets the message and expiration time for the global announcement banner in your enterprise.

announcement.description: The announcement text in GitHub Flavored Markdown. For more information about GitHub Flavored Markdown, see "[Basic writing and formatting syntax](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax)."

expires_at.description: The time at which the announcement expires. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. To set an announcement that never expires, omit this parameter, set it to `null`, or set it to an empty string.

announcement.description: The announcement text in GitHub Flavored Markdown. For more information about GitHub Flavored Markdown, see "[Basic writing and formatting syntax](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax)."

expires_at.description: The time at which the announcement expires. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. To set an announcement that never expires, omit this parameter, set it to `null`, or set it to an empty string.

get.description:
Gets the GitHub Actions permissions policy for organizations and allowed actions in an enterprise.

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

allowed_actions.description: The permissions policy that controls the actions that are allowed to run.

enabled_organizations.description: The policy that controls the organizations in the enterprise that are allowed to run GitHub Actions.

selected_actions_url.description: The API URL to use to get or set the actions that are allowed to run, when `allowed_actions` is set to `selected`.

selected_organizations_url.description: The API URL to use to get or set the selected organizations that are allowed to run GitHub Actions, when `enabled_organizations` is set to `selected`.

get.summary: Get GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise

put.description:
Sets the GitHub Actions permissions policy for organizations and allowed actions in an enterprise.

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

allowed_actions.description: The permissions policy that controls the actions that are allowed to run.

enabled_organizations.description: The policy that controls the organizations in the enterprise that are allowed to run GitHub Actions.

put.summary: Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise

get.description:
Lists the organizations that are selected to have GitHub Actions enabled in an enterprise. To use this endpoint, the enterprise permission policy for `enabled_organizations` must be configured to `selected`. For more information, see "[Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise](#set-github-actions-permissions-for-an-enterprise)."

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

items.description: A GitHub organization.
items.title: Organization Simple

get.summary: List selected organizations enabled for GitHub Actions in an enterprise

put.description:
Replaces the list of selected organizations that are enabled for GitHub Actions in an enterprise. To use this endpoint, the enterprise permission policy for `enabled_organizations` must be configured to `selected`. For more information, see "[Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise](#set-github-actions-permissions-for-an-enterprise)."

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

selected_organization_ids.description: List of organization IDs to enable for GitHub Actions.

items.description: Unique identifier of the organization.

put.summary: Set selected organizations enabled for GitHub Actions in an enterprise

delete.description:
Removes an organization from the list of selected organizations that are enabled for GitHub Actions in an enterprise. To use this endpoint, the enterprise permission policy for `enabled_organizations` must be configured to `selected`. For more information, see "[Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise](#set-github-actions-permissions-for-an-enterprise)."

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization.
parameters.name: org_id

delete.summary: Disable a selected organization for GitHub Actions in an enterprise

put.description:
Adds an organization to the list of selected organizations that are enabled for GitHub Actions in an enterprise. To use this endpoint, the enterprise permission policy for `enabled_organizations` must be configured to `selected`. For more information, see "[Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise](#set-github-actions-permissions-for-an-enterprise)."

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization.
parameters.name: org_id

put.summary: Enable a selected organization for GitHub Actions in an enterprise

get.description:
Gets the selected actions that are allowed in an enterprise. To use this endpoint, the enterprise permission policy for `allowed_actions` must be configured to `selected`. For more information, see "[Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise](#set-github-actions-permissions-for-an-enterprise)."

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

github_owned_allowed.description: Whether GitHub-owned actions are allowed. For example, this includes the actions in the `actions` organization.

patterns_allowed.description: Specifies a list of string-matching patterns to allow specific action(s). Wildcards, tags, and SHAs are allowed. For example, `monalisa/octocat@*`, `monalisa/octocat@v2`, `monalisa/*`.

verified_allowed.description: Whether actions from GitHub Marketplace verified creators are allowed. Set to `true` to allow all actions by GitHub Marketplace verified creators.

get.summary: Get allowed actions for an enterprise

put.description:
Sets the actions that are allowed in an enterprise. To use this endpoint, the enterprise permission policy for `allowed_actions` must be configured to `selected`. For more information, see "[Set GitHub Actions permissions for an enterprise](#set-github-actions-permissions-for-an-enterprise)."

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

github_owned_allowed.description: Whether GitHub-owned actions are allowed. For example, this includes the actions in the `actions` organization.

patterns_allowed.description: Specifies a list of string-matching patterns to allow specific action(s). Wildcards, tags, and SHAs are allowed. For example, `monalisa/octocat@*`, `monalisa/octocat@v2`, `monalisa/*`.

verified_allowed.description: Whether actions from GitHub Marketplace verified creators are allowed. Set to `true` to allow all actions by GitHub Marketplace verified creators.

put.summary: Set allowed actions for an enterprise

Lists all self-hosted runner groups for an enterprise.

parameters.description: Only return runner groups that are allowed to be used by this organization.

items.description: Name of workflow the runner group should be allowed to run. Note that a ref, tag, or long SHA is required.

workflow_restrictions_read_only.description: If `true`, the `restricted_to_workflows` and `selected_workflows` fields cannot be modified.

post.description:
Returns a token that you can pass to the `config` script. The token expires after one hour.

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

#### Example using registration token

Configure your self-hosted runner, replacing `TOKEN` with the registration token provided by this endpoint.

```
./config.sh --url https://github.com/enterprises/octo-enterprise --token TOKEN
```

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

repositories.description: The repositories this token has access to

items.description: A repository on GitHub.

allow_auto_merge.description: Whether to allow Auto-merge to be used on pull requests.

allow_forking.description: Whether to allow forking this repo

allow_merge_commit.description: Whether to allow merge commits for pull requests.

allow_rebase_merge.description: Whether to allow rebase merges for pull requests.

allow_squash_merge.description: Whether to allow squash merges for pull requests.

allow_update_branch.description: Whether or not a pull request head branch that is behind its base branch can always be updated even if it is not required to be up to date before merging.

anonymous_access_enabled.description: Whether anonymous git access is enabled for this repository

default_branch.description: The default branch of the repository.

delete_branch_on_merge.description: Whether to delete head branches when pull requests are merged

disabled.description: Returns whether or not this repository disabled.

is_template.description: Whether this repository acts as a template that can be used to generate new repositories.

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public.

size.description: The size of the repository. Size is calculated hourly. When a repository is initially created, the size is 0.

visibility.description: The repository visibility: public, private, or internal.

web_commit_signoff_required.description: Whether to require contributors to sign off on web-based commits

items.title: Repository

repository_selection.description: Describe whether all repositories have been selected or there's a selection involved

post.summary: Create a registration token for an enterprise

post.description:
Returns a token that you can pass to the `config` script to remove a self-hosted runner from an enterprise. The token expires after one hour.

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

#### Example using remove token

To remove your self-hosted runner from an enterprise, replace `TOKEN` with the remove token provided by this
endpoint.

```
./config.sh remove --token TOKEN
```

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

repositories.description: The repositories this token has access to

items.description: A repository on GitHub.

allow_auto_merge.description: Whether to allow Auto-merge to be used on pull requests.

allow_forking.description: Whether to allow forking this repo

allow_merge_commit.description: Whether to allow merge commits for pull requests.

allow_rebase_merge.description: Whether to allow rebase merges for pull requests.

allow_squash_merge.description: Whether to allow squash merges for pull requests.

allow_update_branch.description: Whether or not a pull request head branch that is behind its base branch can always be updated even if it is not required to be up to date before merging.

anonymous_access_enabled.description: Whether anonymous git access is enabled for this repository

default_branch.description: The default branch of the repository.

delete_branch_on_merge.description: Whether to delete head branches when pull requests are merged

disabled.description: Returns whether or not this repository disabled.

is_template.description: Whether this repository acts as a template that can be used to generate new repositories.

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public.

size.description: The size of the repository. Size is calculated hourly. When a repository is initially created, the size is 0.

visibility.description: The repository visibility: public, private, or internal.

web_commit_signoff_required.description: Whether to require contributors to sign off on web-based commits

items.title: Repository

repository_selection.description: Describe whether all repositories have been selected or there's a selection involved

post.summary: Create a remove token for an enterprise

Forces the removal of a self-hosted runner from an enterprise. You can use this endpoint to completely remove the runner when the machine you were using no longer exists.

You must authenticate using an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope to use this endpoint.

parameters.name: runner_id

items.description: A label for a self hosted runner

type.description: The type of label. Read-only labels are applied automatically when the runner is configured.

os.description: The Operating System of the runner.

get.description: Gets the audit log for an enterprise. To use this endpoint, you must be an enterprise admin, and you must use an access token with the `admin:enterprise` scope.

parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.
parameters.name: enterprise

parameters.description: A search phrase. For more information, see [Searching the audit log](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/setting-up-and-managing-organizations-and-teams/reviewing-the-audit-log-for-your-organization#searching-the-audit-log).
parameters.name: phrase

parameters.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/guides/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api#using-link-headers). If specified, the query only searches for events after this cursor.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/guides/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api#using-link-headers). If specified, the query only searches for events before this cursor.
parameters.name: before

parameters.description:
The order of audit log events. To list newest events first, specify `desc`. To list oldest events first, specify `asc`.

The default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).
parameters.name: per_page

@timestamp.description: The time the audit log event occurred, given as a [Unix timestamp](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

_document_id.description: A unique identifier for an audit event.

action.description: The name of the action that was performed, for example `user.login` or `repo.create`.

actor.description: The actor who performed the action.

actor_id.description: The id of the actor who performed the action.

blocked_user.description: The username of the account being blocked.

created_at.description: The time the audit log event was recorded, given as a [Unix timestamp](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

transport_protocol.description: The type of protocol (for example, HTTP or SSH) used to transfer Git data.

transport_protocol_name.description: A human readable name for the protocol (for example, HTTP or SSH) used to transfer Git data.

user.description: The user that was affected by the action performed (if available).

visibility.description: The repository visibility, for example `public` or `private`.

get.summary: Get the audit log for an enterprise

get.description:
Gets the audit log for an organization. For more information, see "[Reviewing the audit log for your organization](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/setting-up-and-managing-organizations-and-teams/reviewing-the-audit-log-for-your-organization)."

This endpoint is available for organizations on GitHub Enterprise Cloud. To use this endpoint, you must be an organization owner, and you must use an access token with the `admin:org` scope. GitHub Apps must have the `organization_administration` read permission to use this endpoint.

By default, the response includes up to 30 events from the past three months. Use the `phrase` parameter to filter results and retrieve older events. For example, use the `phrase` parameter with the `created` qualifier to filter events based on when the events occurred. For more information, see "[Reviewing the audit log for your organization](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/organizations/keeping-your-organization-secure/managing-security-settings-for-your-organization/reviewing-the-audit-log-for-your-organization#searching-the-audit-log)."

Use pagination to retrieve fewer or more than 30 events. For more information, see "[Resources in the REST API](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#pagination)."

parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: A search phrase. For more information, see [Searching the audit log](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/setting-up-and-managing-organizations-and-teams/reviewing-the-audit-log-for-your-organization#searching-the-audit-log).
parameters.name: phrase

parameters.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/guides/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api#using-link-headers). If specified, the query only searches for events after this cursor.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/guides/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api#using-link-headers). If specified, the query only searches for events before this cursor.
parameters.name: before

parameters.description:
The order of audit log events. To list newest events first, specify `desc`. To list oldest events first, specify `asc`.

The default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

@timestamp.description: The time the audit log event occurred, given as a [Unix timestamp](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

_document_id.description: A unique identifier for an audit event.

action.description: The name of the action that was performed, for example `user.login` or `repo.create`.

actor.description: The actor who performed the action.

actor_id.description: The id of the actor who performed the action.

blocked_user.description: The username of the account being blocked.

created_at.description: The time the audit log event was recorded, given as a [Unix timestamp](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

transport_protocol.description: The type of protocol (for example, HTTP or SSH) used to transfer Git data.

transport_protocol_name.description: A human readable name for the protocol (for example, HTTP or SSH) used to transfer Git data.

user.description: The user that was affected by the action performed (if available).

visibility.description: The repository visibility, for example `public` or `private`.

get.summary: Get the audit log for an organization

get.description:
Displays information about the specific group's usage.  Provides a list of the group's external members as well as a list of teams that this group is connected to.

You can manage team membership with your identity provider using Enterprise Managed Users for GitHub Enterprise Cloud. For more information, see "[GitHub's products](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products)" in the GitHub Help documentation.

parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the group.
parameters.name: group_id

schema.description: Information about an external group's usage and its members

group_id.description: The internal ID of the group

group_name.description: The display name for the group

members.description: An array of external members linked to this group

member_email.description: An email attached to a user

member_id.description: The internal user ID of the identity

teams.description: An array of teams linked to this group

updated_at.description: The date when the group was last updated_at

schema.title: ExternalGroup

get.description:
Lists external groups available in an organization. You can query the groups using the `display_name` parameter, only groups with a `group_name` containing the text provided in the `display_name` parameter will be returned.  You can also limit your page results using the `per_page` parameter. GitHub AE generates a url-encoded `page` token using a cursor value for where the next page begins. For more information on cursor pagination, see "[Offset and Cursor Pagination explained](https://dev.to/jackmarchant/offset-and-cursor-pagination-explained-b89)."

You can manage team membership with your identity provider using Enterprise Managed Users for GitHub Enterprise Cloud. For more information, see "[GitHub's products](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products)" in the GitHub Help documentation.

parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Page token
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Limits the list to groups containing the text in the group name
parameters.name: display_name

group_name.description: The display name of the group

You can manage team membership with your identity provider using Enterprise Managed Users for GitHub Enterprise Cloud. For more information, see "[GitHub's products](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products)" in the GitHub Help documentation.

delete.description: If your GitHub instance uses [LDAP Sync with Active Directory LDAP servers](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/identity-and-access-management/using-ldap-for-enterprise-iam/using-ldap), this API is disabled and will return a `403` response. Active Directory LDAP-authenticated users cannot be unsuspended using the API.

parameters.description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
parameters.name: username

reason.description: The reason the user is being unsuspended. This message will be logged in the [audit log](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/monitoring-activity-in-your-enterprise/reviewing-audit-logs-for-your-enterprise/about-the-audit-log-for-your-enterprise). If you don't provide a `reason`, it will default to "Unsuspended via API by _SITE\_ADMINISTRATOR_", where _SITE\_ADMINISTRATOR_ is the person who performed the action.

put.description:
If your GitHub instance uses [LDAP Sync with Active Directory LDAP servers](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/identity-and-access-management/using-ldap-for-enterprise-iam/using-ldap), Active Directory LDAP-authenticated users cannot be suspended through this API. If you attempt to suspend an Active Directory LDAP-authenticated user through this API, it will return a `403` response.

You can suspend any user account except your own.

Note that, if you choose not to pass any parameters, you'll need to set `Content-Length` to zero when calling out to this endpoint. For more information, see "[HTTP verbs](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#http-verbs)."

parameters.description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
parameters.name: username

reason.description: The reason the user is being suspended. This message will be logged in the [audit log](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/monitoring-activity-in-your-enterprise/reviewing-audit-logs-for-your-enterprise/about-the-audit-log-for-your-enterprise). If you don't provide a `reason`, it will default to "Suspended via API by _SITE\_ADMINISTRATOR_", where _SITE\_ADMINISTRATOR_ is the person who performed the action.
